title: To Present a Proposal for Developing the Business Plan for the Ontario Digital Library

outline.text: Ontario’s Libraries Working Together
To Present a Proposal for Developing the Business Plan for the Ontario Digital Library
Ontario’s Digital Library
A Critical Component for Implementing Ontario’s Road Map to Prosperity Strategy
Summary
This business plan must be completed and approved by the ODL Steering Committee no later than September 30, 2003
Timeline:
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 2
Background
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 3
The principles which will define and guide the ODL are:
Equitable access for all Ontarians:
We will bring consistent, high-quality electronic resources and services to 10 million Ontario citizens
Shared decision-making and accountability:
We will facilitate consensus among members regarding ODL’s portfolio of electronic licenses and services
Shared governance structure:
Shared funding:
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 4
Local points of entry:
Services envisioned for the ODL’s include:
Access:
Guidance and Advice:
Training:
for library workers for the general public
Provincial Purchasing & Licensing:
of electronic content on a consortia basis for all member libraries
Technological Support:
What could the ODL really mean?
For each Ontario citizen it could mean:
For each Ontario student it could mean:
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 5
For each Ontario library it could mean:
For the Ontario government it could mean:
The Business Plan to be Developed
Specifically, the business plan must include:
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 6
the marketing and communications plan for the ODL the commitment of all stakeholders to their responsibilities
Milestones
1) A preliminary report will be issued during June 2003.
Approach and Specific Proposal Requirements
The proposal should include the following information:
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 7
Evaluation and Awarding of Contract
Specifically, proposals will be evaluated proposals according to the following criteria:
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 8
Appendix A:  ODL Envisioned Phases & Funding
Phase I:  Business Planning
Result:  The ODL business plan
Phase II: Implementing and Transitioning
Result:  The ODL is implemented and validated
Phase III: Operating and Growing the ODL
Timeline:  January 2007 - Funding:  $50 Million annually ($35 Million requested from government)
Result:  The ODL is fully operational and sustainable
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 9
1. that ODL expenditures will increase by 50% over a 10 year period
2. that government funding will decrease from 70% to 45% during that 10 year period
3. that library contributions, endowment and gifts/in-kind funding will increase from 30% to 55% during the same period
OVERVIEW OF ODL FUNDING MODEL
Funding Source 2007 2017
TOTAL ANNUAL $50M $75M
RFP: To Develop the Ontario Digital Library Business Plan March 2003 10 10 10 10

4. Appointment Criteria and Process
4.2 Desired characteristics for steering committee appointees include:
• Strategic thinkers;
• Committed to the concept of multi-sector partnerships;
• Knowledgeable about digital libraries and resources;
• Knowledgeable about government structures;
• Respected by their communities; influential;
• Able to take a consultative approach;
